Name: Achalasia
Specialty: Thoracic surgery, general surgery, laparoscopic surgery
Symptoms: Anorexia (but willing and trying to eat), inability to swallow food, chest pain comparable to heart attack, lightheadedness, dehydration, excessive vomiting after eating (often without nausea).
Usual onset: Normally in mid-to-late life, rarely during youth
Risk factors: Inconclusive, but possibly: history of autoimmune disorders, air-hunger that accompanies anxiety, faulty eating habits, improper diet
Diagnostic method: Esophageal Manometry, Biopsy, X-ray, Barrium swallow study, Endoscopy
Treatment: Heller Myotomy and Fundoplomy, POEM, Pneumatic Dilation, Botulinum Toxin
Prognosis: ~76% chance of survival after 20 years (in a western country such as Germany)

Name: Achilles tendon rupture
Symptoms: Pain in the heel
Causes: Forced plantar flexion of the foot, direct trauma, long-standing tendonitis
Risk factors: Fluoroquinolones, significant change in exercise, rheumatoid arthritis, gout, corticosteroids
Diagnostic method: Based on symptoms and examination, supported by medical imaging

Name: Adjustment disorders
Usual onset: Theoretically, within one to three months after a stressful event.
Duration: Theoretically, up to six months unless the stressor or its consequences continue.
Risk factors: History of mental disorder; low social support.
Prognosis: Relatively good compared to many other mental disorders, but severity varies.

Name: Agoraphobia
Symptoms: Anxiety in situations perceived to be unsafe, panic attacks
Risk factors: Family history, stressful event

Name: Alcohol use disorder
Specialty: Psychiatry, clinical psychology, toxicology, addiction medicine
Symptoms: Drinking large amounts of alcohol over a long period, difficulty cutting down, acquiring and drinking alcohol taking up a lot of time, usage resulting in problems, withdrawal occurring when stopping
Risk factors: Stress, anxiety, inexpensive, easy access
Treatment: Alcohol cessation typically with benzodiazepines, counselling, acamprosate, disulfiram, naltrexone

Name: Allergies
Symptoms: Red eyes, itchy rash, runny nose, shortness of breath, swelling, sneezing
Diagnostic method: Based on symptoms, skin prick test, blood test
Treatment: Avoiding known allergens, medications, allergen immunotherapy
Medication: Steroids, antihistamines, epinephrine, mast cell stabilizers, antileukotrienes

Name: Amniotic fluid embolism
Risk factors: Unpredictable

Name: Amyloidosis
Symptoms: Feeling tired, weight loss, swelling of the legs, shortness of breath, bleeding, feeling light headed with standing
Treatment: Supportive care, directed at the underlying cause, dialysis, organ transplantation

Name: Anaphylaxis
Symptoms: Itchy rash, throat swelling, numbness, shortness of breath, lightheadedness,

Name: Anemia
Symptoms: Feeling tired, pale skin, weakness, shortness of breath, feeling like passing out
Causes: Bleeding, decreased red blood cell production, increased red blood cell breakdown

Name: Angelman syndrome
Symptoms: Delayed development, unusually happy, intellectual disability, limited to no functional speech, balance and movement problems, small head, seizures

Name: Angiosarcoma
Symptoms: Often asymptomatic, non-specific symptoms common
Usual onset: Typically 60-70 however all age groups are affected
Risk factors: Lymphedema, radiation therapy, various chemicals
Prognosis: Depends on type, overall five-year survival ~ 30-38%

Name: Ankylosing spondylitis
Symptoms: Back pain, joint stiffness
Diagnostic method: Symptom based, medical imaging, blood tests

Name: Anterior cruciate ligament injury
Symptoms: Audible "crack" with pain, knee instability, swelling of knee
Risk factors: Athletes, females

Name: Anthrax

Risk factors: Working with animals, travelers, postal workers, military personnel
Diagnostic method: Based on antibodies or toxin in the blood, microbial culture

Name: Anxiety disorders
Symptoms: Worrying, fast heart rate, shakiness
Risk factors: Child abuse, family history, poverty

Name: Aplastic anemia
Symptoms: pale skin, hematoma, fast heart rate
Risk factors: Smoking, family history, ionizing radiation, some chemicals, prior chemotherapy, Down syndrome.
Treatment: bone marrow transplant, chemotherapy, radiotherapy, targeted therapy

Name: Appendicitis
Symptoms: Right lower abdominal pain, vomiting, decreased appetite
Diagnostic method: Based on symptoms, medical imaging, blood tests
Treatment: Surgical removal of the appendix, antibiotics

Name: ARDS
Symptoms: Shortness of breath, rapid breathing, bluish skin coloration Chest pain or pressure, Loss of speech of movement
Diagnostic method: Adults: PaO2/FiO2 ratio of less than 300 mmÂ HgChildren: oxygenation index > 4

Name: Arthritis
Symptoms: Joint pain, stiffness, redness, swelling, decreased range of motion

Name: Asbestosis
Symptoms: Shortness of breath, cough, wheezing, chest pain
Treatment: Supportive care, stopping smoking, vaccination, oxygen therapy

Name: Ascariasis
Symptoms: Abdominal swelling, abdominal pain, diarrhea, shortness of breath

Name: Asthma
Symptoms: Recurring episodes of wheezing, coughing, chest tightness, shortness of breath
Risk factors: Air pollution, allergens
Diagnostic method: Based on symptoms, response to therapy, spirometry

Name: Asthma attack
Symptoms: Recurring episodes of wheezing, coughing, chest tightness, shortness of breath
Risk factors: Air pollution, allergens
Diagnostic method: Based on symptoms, response to therapy, spirometry

Name: Astigmatism
Symptoms: Distorted or blurred vision at all distances, eyestrain, headaches

Name: Ataxia

Name: Atrial fibrillation
Symptoms: None, heart palpitations, fainting, shortness of breath, chest pain
Risk factors: High blood pressure, valvular heart disease, coronary artery disease, cardiomyopathy, congenital heart disease, COPD, obesity, smoking, sleep apnea
Treatment: Lifestyle modifications, rate control, rhythm control, anticoagulation

Name: Atypical depression
Symptoms: Low mood, mood reactivity, hyperphagia, hypersomnia, leaden paralysis, interpersonal rejection sensitivity
Risk factors: Bipolar disorder, anxiety disorder, female sex

Name: Autism spectrum disorder
Specialty: Clinical psychology, psychiatry, pediatrics, occupational medicine
Symptoms: Impairments in social interaction, verbal and nonverbal communication, and the presence of restricted interests and repetitive behavior
Risk factors: Family history, certain genetic conditions, having older parents, certain prescribed drugs, perinatal and neonatal health issues
Diagnostic method: Based on observation of behavior and development
Treatment: Behavioral therapy, educational therapy, psychotropic medication

Name: Autoimmune pancreatitis
Symptoms: Painless jaundice, pancreatic mass

Name: AVNRT
Symptoms: Palpitations, chest tightness, neck pulsation
Medication: adenosine, calcium channel antagonists, beta blockers, flecainide

Name: Bacterial vaginosis
Symptoms: Vaginal discharge that often smells like fish, burning with urination
Causes: Imbalance of the naturally occurring bacteria in the vagina
Risk factors: Douching, new or multiple sex partners, antibiotics, using an intrauterine device

Name: Barotrauma
Symptoms: Dependent on cause

Name: Bladder stones
Symptoms: Pain

Name: Botulism
Symptoms: Weakness, trouble seeing, feeling tired, trouble speaking
Diagnostic method: Finding the bacteria or their toxin
Prevention: Proper food preparation, no honey for children younger than one

Name: Brain tumor

Risk factors: Neurofibromatosis, exposure to vinyl chloride, Epsteinâ€“Barr virus, ionizing radiation
Diagnostic method: Computed tomography, magnetic resonance imaging, tissue biopsy

Name: Broken ankle

Name: Broken collarbone
Symptoms: Pain, decreased ability to move the affected arm
Causes: Fall onto a shoulder, outstretched arm, or direct trauma
Diagnostic method: Based on symptoms, confirmed with X-rays
Prognosis: Up to five months for complete healing
Frequency: 5% of adult fractures, 13% of children's fractures

Name: Broken toe
Symptoms: Pain, tenderness, bruising, swelling, displacement of the bones.
Causes: Stubbing or crushing over-extending a toe joint, stress fracture
Treatment: For pain and swelling, rest, icing, elevation and pain medication; wearing a stiff-soled shoe; for smaller toes, buddy wrapping (taping the toe to the nearest toe, with some absorbent padding in-between); rarely, a cast or surgery
Prognosis: 4 to 8 weeks for full healing; pain lessens within days

Name: Bronchiolitis
Symptoms: Fever, cough, runny nose, wheezing, breathing problems
Causes: Viral disease (respiratory syncytial virus, human rhinovirus)
Treatment: Symptomatic treatment (oxygen, support with feeding, intravenous fluids)

Name: Bronchitis
Symptoms: Coughing up mucus, wheezing, shortness of breath, chest discomfort
Frequency: Acute: ~5% of people a yearChronic: ~5% of people

Name: Brucellosis
Symptoms: coughing

Name: Brugada syndrome
Symptoms: Passing out, sudden cardiac death
Risk factors: Family history, Asian descent, male

Name: Bunions
Symptoms: Prominent, red, and painful joint at the base of the big toe
Risk factors: Wearing overly tight shoes, high-heeled shoes, family history, rheumatoid arthritis

Name: C. difficile infection
Symptoms: Diarrhea, fever, nausea, abdominal pain
Causes: Clostridioides difficile spread by the fecal-oral route
Risk factors: Antibiotics, proton pump inhibitors, hospitalization, other health problems, older age
Diagnostic method: Stool culture, testing for the bacteria's DNA or toxins
Prevention: Hand washing, terminal room cleaning in hospital
Treatment: Metronidazole, vancomycin, fidaxomicin, fecal microbiota transplantation

Name: Calciphylaxis
Prognosis: 1- and 5-year survival rates are estimated to be 45% and 35%, respectively

Name: Cancer
Symptoms: Lump, abnormal bleeding, prolonged cough, unexplained weight loss, change in bowel movements
Risk factors: Tobacco, obesity, poor diet, lack of physical activity, excessive alcohol, certain infections
Treatment: Radiation therapy, surgery, chemotherapy, and targeted therapy.

Name: Carbon monoxide poisoning
Symptoms: Headache, dizziness, weakness, vomiting, chest pain, confusion
Prevention: Carbon monoxide detectors, venting of gas appliances, maintenance of exhaust systems
Treatment: Supportive care, 100% oxygen, hyperbaric oxygen therapy
Frequency: >20,000 emergency visits for non-fire related cases per year (US)

Name: Cardiogenic shock
Symptoms: Fatigue, rapid heartbeat, shortness of breath, hypotension, sweating
Causes: Heart attack, myocarditis, endocarditis, certain medications and substances
Risk factors: Heart failure, old age, hypertension
Prognosis: For patients where the cause is not due to a heart attack, the mortality rate is still relatively high, at about 60%; some progress has been made in treating CS when due to a heart attack, and the mortality rate is now somewhat lower for those with MI who survive and are treated rapidly with current therapies (February 2021)

Name: Cardiomyopathy
Symptoms: Shortness of breathFeeling tiredSwelling of the legs

Name: Carpal tunnel syndrome
Symptoms: Pain, numbness, tingling in the thumb, index, middle finger, and half of ring finger, weak grip
Causes: Compression of the median nerve at the carpal tunnel
Risk factors: Genetics, obesity, repetitive wrist work, rheumatoid arthritis
Diagnostic method: Based on symptoms, specific physical tests, electrodiagnostic tests

Name: Cataracts
Symptoms: Faded colors, blurry vision, halos around light, trouble with bright lights, trouble seeing at night
Causes: Aging, trauma, radiation exposure, following eye surgery, genetic
Risk factors: Diabetes, smoking tobacco, prolonged exposure to sunlight, alcohol

Name: Cellulitis
Symptoms: Red, hot, painful area of skin, fever
Risk factors: Break in the skin, obesity, leg swelling, old age

Name: Cerebral aneurysm
Symptoms: None, severe headache, visual problems, nausea and vomiting, confusion
Risk factors: Smoking, old age, family history, cocaine use
Treatment: Endovascular coiling, surgical clipping, cerebral bypass surgery, pipeline embolization

Name: Cervical cancer
Symptoms: Early: noneLater: vaginal bleeding, pelvic pain, pain during sexual intercourse
Risk factors: Smoking, weak immune system, birth control pills, starting sex at a young age, many sexual partners or a partner with many sexual partners
Diagnostic method: Cervical screening followed by a biopsy
Prevention: Regular cervical screening, HPV vaccines, sexual intercourse with condoms, sexual abstinence

Name: Cholera
Symptoms: Large amounts of watery diarrhea, vomiting, muscle cramps
Causes: Vibrio cholerae spread by fecal-oral route
Risk factors: Poor sanitation, not enough clean drinking water, poverty
Prevention: Improved sanitation, clean water, hand washing, cholera vaccines
Treatment: Oral rehydration therapy, zinc supplementation, intravenous fluids, antibiotics

Name: Chronic traumatic encephalopathy
Symptoms: Behavioral problems, mood problems, problems with thinking
Risk factors: Contact sports, military, domestic abuse, repeated banging of the head

Name: Cirrhosis
Symptoms: Tiredness, itchiness, swelling in the lower legs, jaundice, easily bruising, fluid build-up in the abdomen
Causes: Alcoholic liver disease, hepatitis B, hepatitis C, non-alcoholic steatohepatitis
Diagnostic method: Blood tests, medical imaging, liver biopsy
Prevention: Vaccination (such as hepatitis B), avoiding alcohol

Name: Cleft lip and cleft palate
Symptoms: Opening in the upper lip that may extend into the nose or palate
Risk factors: Smoking during pregnancy, diabetes, obesity, older mother, certain medications

Name: Clubfoot
Symptoms: Foot that is rotated inwards and downwards
Risk factors: Genetics, mother who smokes cigarettes, males Ethnicity
Treatment: Ponseti method (manipulation, casting, cutting the Achilles tendon, braces), French method, surgery

Name: Colorectal cancer
Symptoms: vomiting blood, Blood in the stool, change in bowel movements, weight loss, fatigue.
Causes: Old age, lifestyle factors, genetic disorders
Risk factors: Diet, obesity, smoking, lack of physical activity, alcohol use
Diagnostic method: Tissue biopsy during a sigmoidoscopy or colonoscopy
Treatment: Surgery, radiation therapy, chemotherapy, targeted therapy

Name: Common cold
Symptoms: Cough, sore throat, runny nose, fever
Prevention: Hand washing, face masks, cough etiquette, avoiding sick people

Name: Concussion
Symptoms: Headache, trouble with thinking, memory or concentration, nausea, blurry vision, sleep disturbances, mood changes
Causes: Motor vehicle collisions, falls, sports injuries, bicycle accidents
Risk factors: Drinking alcohol, playing contact sports such as American football, previous history of concussion
Prevention: Head protection equipment, like hard hats, gridiron football, motorcycle, or bicycle helmets
Treatment: Physical and cognitive rest for a day or two with a gradual return to activities

Name: Congenital adrenal hyperplasia
Symptoms: Excessive urination of sodium, virilism, early, delayed, or absent puberty, hyperandrogenism
Causes: Variants in genes responsible the enzymes required for the synthesis of cortisol in the adrenal cortex

Name: Constipation
Symptoms: Infrequent or hard to pass bowel movements, abdominal pain, bloating
Causes: Slow movement of stool within the colon, irritable bowel syndrome, celiac disease, non-celiac gluten sensitivity, pelvic floor disorders
Risk factors: Hypothyroidism, diabetes, Parkinson's disease, gluten-related disorders, colon cancer, ovarian cancer, diverticulitis, inflammatory bowel disease, certain medications
Treatment: Drinking enough fluids, eating more fiber, exercise
Medication: Laxatives of the bulk forming agent, osmotic agent, stool softener, or lubricant type

Name: COPD
Symptoms: Shortness of breath, chronic cough
Prevention: Stopping smoking, improving indoor and outdoor air quality, tobacco control measures
Treatment: Pulmonary rehabilitation, long-term oxygen therapy, lung volume reduction

Name: Coronary artery disease
Symptoms: Chest pain, shortness of breath
Causes: Atherosclerosis of the arteries of the heart
Risk factors: High blood pressure, smoking, diabetes, lack of exercise, obesity, high blood cholesterol
Diagnostic method: Electrocardiogram, cardiac stress test, coronary computed tomographic angiography, coronary angiogram
Prevention: Healthy diet, regular exercise, maintaining a healthy weight, not smoking
Treatment: Percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI), coronary artery bypass surgery (CABG)

Name: Croup
Symptoms: "Barky" cough, stridor, fever, stuffy nose
Duration: Usually 1â€“2 days but can last up to 7 days

Name: CRPS
Treatment: Physical therapy (more effective with early diagnosis); medications (e.g. anti-seizure for nerve pain, opioids, muscle relaxers etc.); Sympathetic Nerve Blocks; ketamine infusions; lidocaine infusions; implanted opioid pump; in rare cases amputation
Medication: Anti-seizure medications for nerve pain (e.g. Gabapentin); muscle relaxers (e.g. Baclofen), opioids (may be administered orally, via patch, or implanted intrathecal pump); ketamine or lidocaine infusions

Name: Cyclothymic disorder
Symptoms: Periods of depression and elevated mood
Risk factors: Family history

Name: Cystitis
Symptoms: Pain with urination, frequent urination, feeling the need to urinate despite having an empty bladder
Risk factors: Female anatomy, sexual intercourse, diabetes, obesity, family history

Name: Dandruff
Symptoms: Itchy and flaking skin of the scalp

Name: Delirium
Specialty: Psychiatry, Geriatrics, Intensive care medicine, Neurology
Symptoms: agitation, confusion, drowsiness, hallucinations, delusions, memory problems
Usual onset: Any age, but more often in people 65 or more years of age
Risk factors: Infection, chronic health problems, certain medications, neurological problems, sleep deprivation, surgery

Name: Dementia
Symptoms: Decreased ability to think and remember, emotional problems, problems with language, decreased motivation
Causes: Alzheimer's disease, vascular disease, Lewy body disease and frontotemporal lobar degeneration.
Prevention: Early education, prevent high blood pressure, prevent obesity, no smoking, social engagement

Name: Dengue hemorrhagic fever
Symptoms: Fever, headache, muscle and joint pain, rash
Diagnostic method: Detecting antibodies to the virus or its RNA
Prevention: Dengue fever vaccine, decreasing mosquito exposure
Treatment: Supportive care, intravenous fluids, blood transfusions

Name: Depersonalization-derealization disorder
Symptoms: Depersonalization, Derealization

Name: Dermatitis
Symptoms: Itchiness, red skin, rash
Causes: Atopic dermatitis, allergic contact dermatitis, irritant contact dermatitis, seborrhoeic dermatitis, stasis dermatitis

Name: Dermatomyositis
Symptoms: Rash, muscle weakness, weight loss, fever
Diagnostic method: Based on symptoms, blood tests, electromyography, muscle biopsies

Name: Diabetes
Symptoms: Frequent urination, increased thirst, increased hunger
Risk factors: Type 1: Family historyType 2: Obesity, lack of exercise, genetics

Name: Diabetes insipidus
Symptoms: Large amounts of dilute urine, increased thirst
Diagnostic method: Urine tests, blood tests, fluid deprivation test

Name: Diabetic nephropathy
Symptoms: Albuminuria, peripheral edema, high blood pressure, tiredness
Risk factors: High blood pressure, tobacco smoking, unstable blood glucose

Name: Diarrhea
Symptoms: Loose frequent bowel movements, dehydration
Risk factors: Contaminated food or water

Name: Dilated cardiomyopathy
Symptoms: Feeling tired, leg swelling, shortness of breath, chest pain, fainting
Causes: Genetics, alcohol, cocaine, certain toxins, complications of pregnancy, in many cases the cause remains unclear, certain infections
Diagnostic method: Supported by electrocardiogram, chest X-ray, echocardiogram
Treatment: Lifestyle changes, medications, implantable cardioverter defibrillator, cardiac resynchronization therapy (CRT), heart transplant
Medication: ACE inhibitor, beta blocker, diuretic, blood thinners

Name: Diphtheria
Symptoms: Sore throat, fever, barking cough
Causes: Corynebacterium diphtheriae (spread by direct contact and through the air)

Name: Diverticulitis
Symptoms: Abdominal pain, fever, nausea, diarrhea, constipation, blood in the stool
Risk factors: Obesity, lack of exercise, smoking, family history, nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs
Diagnostic method: Blood tests, CT scan, colonoscopy, lower gastrointestinal series

Name: Dust mite allergy
Symptoms: Symptoms

Name: DVT

Risk factors: Recent surgery, older age, active cancer, obesity, infection, inflammatory diseases, antiphospholipid syndrome, personal history or family history of VTE, injuries, trauma, lack of movement, hormonal birth control, pregnancy and the period following delivery, genetic factors
Prevention: Frequent walking, calf exercises, maintaining a healthy body weight, anticoagulants (blood thinners), intermittent pneumatic compression, graduated compression stockings, aspirin
Frequency: From 0.8â€“2.7 per 1000 people per year, but populations in China and Korea are below this range
Medication: Direct oral anticoagulants, low-molecular-weight heparin, fondaparinux, unfractionated heparin, warfarin

Name: Dwarfism
Causes: Hyposecretion of growth hormone from pituitary gland (growth hormone deficiency), genetic disorders

Name: Dysarthria
Symptoms: Slurred speech, Weak execution of oral musculary movements

Name: Dystonia
Causes: hereditary (DYT1); birth injury; head trauma; medication; infection; toxins
Diagnostic method: genetic testing, electromyography, blood tests, MRI or CT scan
Treatment: medication, physical therapy, botulinum toxin injection, deep brain stimulation

Name: Eating disorders
Symptoms: Abnormal eating habits that negatively affect physical or mental health
Risk factors: Gastrointestinal disorders, history of sexual abuse, being a dancer or gymnast
Treatment: Counseling, proper diet, normal amount of exercise, medications

Name: Ectopic pregnancy
Symptoms: Abdominal pain, vaginal bleeding
Risk factors: Pelvic inflammatory disease, tobacco smoking, prior tubal surgery, history of infertility, use of assisted reproductive technology
Diagnostic method: Blood tests for human chorionic gonadotropin (hCG), ultrasound

Name: Eczema
Symptoms: Itchiness, red skin, rash
Causes: Atopic dermatitis, allergic contact dermatitis, irritant contact dermatitis, seborrhoeic dermatitis, stasis dermatitis

Name: Edema
Symptoms: Skin which feels tight, area may feel heavy
Causes: Venous insufficiency, heart failure, kidney problems, low protein levels, liver problems, deep vein thrombosis, lymphedema

Name: Ehlers-Danlos syndrome
Symptoms: Overly flexible joints, stretchy skin, abnormal scar formation
Usual onset: Childhood or teens depending on type.
Risk factors: Family history

Name: Ehrlichiosis
Symptoms: Fever, chills, severe headaches, muscle aches, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, loss of appetite, confusion, and splotchy or pinpoint rash. More severe symptoms include brain or nervous system damage, respiratory failure, uncontrollable bleeding, organ failure, and death.
Risk factors: Age, being immunocompromised, having received an organ transplant, and certain medications

Name: Elevated blood pressure
Symptoms: None
Risk factors: Lack of sleep, Excess salt, excess body weight, smoking, alcohol Air Pollution

Name: Emphysema
Symptoms: Shortness of breath, chronic cough
Prevention: Stopping smoking, improving indoor and outdoor air quality, tobacco control measures
Treatment: Pulmonary rehabilitation, long-term oxygen therapy, lung volume reduction

Name: Encephalitis
Symptoms: Headache, fever, confusion, stiff neck, vomiting
Diagnostic method: Based on symptoms, supported by blood tests, medical imaging, analysis of cerebrospinal fluid
Treatment: Antiviral medication, anticonvulsants, corticosteroids, artificial respiration

Name: Endometriosis
Symptoms: Pelvic pain, infertility
Risk factors: Family history
Diagnostic method: Based on symptoms, medical imaging, tissue biopsy
Prevention: Combined birth control pills, exercise, avoiding alcohol and caffeine
Treatment: NSAIDs, continuous birth control pills, intrauterine device with progestogen, surgery

Name: End-stage renal disease
Symptoms: Early: NoneLater: Leg swelling, feeling tired, vomiting, loss of appetite, confusion
Causes: Diabetes, high blood pressure, glomerulonephritis, polycystic kidney disease
Treatment: Medications to manage blood pressure, blood sugar, and lower cholesterol, renal replacement therapy, kidney transplant

Name: Eosinophilic granulomatosis with polyangiitis
Symptoms: Fatigue, fever, weight loss, night sweats, abdominal pain, cough, joint pain, muscle pain, bleeding into tissues under the skin, a rash with hives, small bumps, or a general feeling of ill.
Risk factors: History of allergy, asthma and asthma-associated lung abnormalities (i.e., pulmonary infiltrates).
Diagnostic method: antineutrophil cytoplasmic antibodies (ANCA); cluster of asthma, eosinophilia, mono- or polyneuropathy, nonfixed pulmonary infiltrates, abnormality of the paranasal sinuses, and extravascular eosinophilia.
Treatment: Suppress the activity of the immune system to alleviate inflammation.
Medication: Corticosteroid medications such as prednisone or methylprednisolone, and mepolizumab. Proliferation inhibitor for those with the presence of kidney or neurological disease.

Name: Epidermolysis bullosa
Symptoms: Painful skin blisters
Treatment: Wound care, pain control, controlling infections, nutritional support

Name: Epididymitis
Symptoms: Pain in the back of the testicle, swelling of the testicle, burning with urination, frequent urination
Causes: Gonorrhea, chlamydia, enteric bacteria, reflux of urine

Name: Epiglottitis
Symptoms: Trouble swallowing, drooling, changes to the voice, fever, increased breathing rate, stridor
Causes: H. influenzae type b, burns, trauma to the area
Diagnostic method: Medical imaging, looking at the epiglottis

Name: Esophageal cancer
Symptoms: Difficulty swallowing, weight loss, hoarse voice, enlarged lymph nodes around the collarbone, vomiting blood, blood in the stool
Risk factors: Smoking tobacco, alcohol, very hot drinks, chewing betel nut, obesity, acid reflux

Name: Essential tremor
Risk factors: Family history, exposure to particular toxins
Medication: Beta blockers, primidone, anti-epileptics, topiramate, gabapentin, levetiracetam, benzodiazepines

Name: Ewing sarcoma
Symptoms: Swell and pain near the tumor
Treatment: Chemotherapy, radiation therapy, surgery, stem cell transplant

Name: Fetal alcohol syndrome
Symptoms: Abnormal appearance, short height, low body weight, small head size, poor coordination, behavior problems similar to those found in ADHD, learning problems
Treatment: Parent-child interaction therapy, efforts to modify child behavior, possibly medications
Prognosis: Varies depending on the victim. Life expectancy can range from 31 to 37. Average death age is 34.

Name: Fever

Name: Fever blister
Symptoms: Burning pain followed by small blisters or sores
Causes: Typically herpes simplex virus type 1 (direct contact)
Treatment: Zinc oxide, anesthetic, or antiviral cream, antivirals by mouth

Name: Fibromyalgia
Symptoms: Widespread pain, feeling tired, sleep problems
Diagnostic method: Based on symptoms after ruling out other potential causes
Treatment: Sufficient sleep and exercise, healthy diet

Name: Fibrous dysplasia
Symptoms: Bone pain, bone deformities, local swelling
Usual onset: Adolescence or early adulthood (monostotic), before age 10 (polyostotic)

Name: Food allergy
Symptoms: Itchiness, swelling of the tongue, vomiting, diarrhea, hives, trouble breathing, low blood pressure

Risk factors: Family history, vitamin D deficiency, obesity, high levels of cleanliness

Treatment: Avoiding the food in question, having a plan if exposure occurs, medical alert jewelry

Name: Frostbite
Symptoms: Numbness, feeling cold, clumsiness, pale color
Risk factors: Alcohol, smoking, mental health problems, certain medications, prior cold injury
Prevention: Avoid cold, wear proper clothing, maintain hydration and nutrition, stay active without becoming exhausted

Name: Frozen shoulder
Symptoms: Shoulder pain, stiffness
Risk factors: Diabetes, hypothyroidism
Treatment: NSAIDs, physical therapy, steroids, injecting the shoulder at high pressure, surgery

Name: Gallbladder cancer
Symptoms: Abdominal pain, Bloating, Fever, Unexplained weight loss, Nausea, Yellowing of the skin, although some people may have no symptoms
Risk factors: History of Gallstones and other Gallbladder diseases
Diagnostic method: Blood tests, medical imaging, examination of the Bile duct

Name: Gallstones
Symptoms: None, crampy pain in the right upper abdomen
Risk factors: Birth control pills, pregnancy, family history, obesity, diabetes, liver disease, rapid weight loss
Diagnostic method: Based on symptoms, confirmed by ultrasound
Prevention: Healthy weight, diet high in fiber, diet low in simple carbohydrates
Treatment: Asymptomatic: none, ursodeoxycholic acid (UDCA) and Chenodeoxycholic acid Pain: surgery ERCP, Cholecystectomy

Name: Ganglion cyst
Symptoms: Small soft lump associated with a joint
Treatment: Watchful waiting, splinting the affected joint, needle aspiration, surgery

Name: Gangrene
Symptoms: Change in skin color to red or black, numbness, pain, skin breakdown, coolness
Risk factors: Diabetes, peripheral arterial disease, smoking, major trauma, alcoholism, plague, HIV/AIDS, frostbite, Raynaud's syndrome
Diagnostic method: Based on symptom, With medical imaging used to identify the underlying cause.

Name: Gastritis
Symptoms: Upper abdominal pain, nausea, vomiting, bloating, loss of appetite, heartburn
Causes: Helicobacter pylori, NSAIDs, alcohol, smoking, cocaine, severe illness, autoimmune problems
Diagnostic method: Endoscopy, upper gastrointestinal series, blood tests, stool tests
Treatment: Antacids, H2 blockers, proton pump inhibitors, antibiotics

Name: Gastrointestinal bleeding

Causes: Upper: peptic ulcer disease, esophageal varices due to liver cirrhosis, cancerLower: hemorrhoids, cancer, inflammatory bowel disease
Diagnostic method: Medical history and physical examination, blood tests
Frequency: Upper: 100 per 100,000 adults per yearLower: 25 per 100,000 per year

Name: Gastroparesis
Symptoms: Nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, feeling full after eating just a few bites

Name: Gender identity disorder
Symptoms: Distress related to one's assigned gender or sex

Name: Generalized anxiety disorder
Symptoms: Excessive worry, restlessness, trouble sleeping, feeling tired, irritability, sweating, trembling

Name: Gestational diabetes
Symptoms: Typically few symptoms

Name: Gout
Symptoms: Joint pain, swelling, and redness

Name: Hair loss

Name: Hardening of the arteries

Name: Heart murmurs

Name: Hemophilia
Symptoms: Easy and prolonged bleeding

Name: Hepatitis A
Symptoms: Nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, dark urine, jaundice, fever, abdominal pain

Prevention: Hepatitis A vaccine, hand washing, properly cooking food

Name: Hepatitis B
Symptoms: None, yellowish skin, tiredness, dark urine, abdominal pain

Causes: Hepatitis B virus spread by some body fluids
Risk factors: Intravenous drug use, sexual intercourse, dialysis, living with an infected person

Name: Hepatitis C
Symptoms: Typically none
Causes: Hepatitis C virus usually spread by blood-to-blood contact
Diagnostic method: Blood testing for antibodies or viral RNA

Name: Hereditary hemorrhagic telangiectasia
Symptoms: Nosebleeds, Gastrointestinal bleeding

Name: Hiatal hernia
Symptoms: Taste of acid in the back of the mouth, heartburn, trouble swallowing
Risk factors: Obesity, older age, major trauma
Treatment: Raising the head of the bed, weight loss, medications, surgery

Name: Hidradenitis suppurativa
Symptoms: Multiple inflamed and swollen skin lesions
Frequency: 1â€“4% of people, when mild cases are included

Name: Hip dysplasia

Name: Hip fracture
Symptoms: Pain around the hip particularly with movement, shortening of the leg
Risk factors: Osteoporosis, taking many medications, alcohol use, metastatic cancer
Diagnostic method: X-ray, MRI, CT scan, bone scan
Prevention: Improved lighting, removal of loose rugs, exercise, treatment of osteoporosis
Prognosis: ~20% one year risk of death (older people)

Name: Hirsutism
Treatment: Birth control pills, antiandrogens, insulin sensitizers

Name: Hoarding disorder
Causes: not clear, possibly genetic, and stressful life experiences
Risk factors: Traumatic events
Frequency: 2-5% of the UK population. Up to 6% (US)

Name: Human papillomavirus infection
Symptoms: None, warts
Causes: Human papillomavirus spread by direct contact
Risk factors: sexual contact
Frequency: Most people are infected at some point in time

Name: Hydrocephalus
Symptoms: Babies: rapid head growth, vomiting, sleepiness, seizuresOlder people: Headaches, double vision, poor balance, urinary incontinence, personality changes, mental impairment

Diagnostic method: Based on symptoms and medical imaging

Name: Hypercortisolism

Name: Hyperopia
Symptoms: Near blur, Distance and near blur, Asthenopia

Name: Hyperparathyroidism

Name: Hypertension
Symptoms: None
Risk factors: Lack of sleep, Excess salt, excess body weight, smoking, alcohol Air Pollution

Name: Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy
Symptoms: Feeling tired, leg swelling, shortness of breath, chest pain, fainting
Causes: Genetics, Fabry disease, Friedreich's ataxia, certain medications
Diagnostic method: Electrocardiogram, echocardiogram, stress testing, genetic testing
Prognosis: Less than 1% per year risk of death (with treatment)

Name: Hyponatremia
Symptoms: Decreased ability to think, headaches, nausea, poor balance, confusion, seizures, coma

Name: Illness anxiety disorder
Symptoms: Excessive and persistent fear of, or preoccupation with, having or developing a severe illness

Name: Impetigo
Symptoms: Yellowish skin crusts, painful
Causes: Staphylococcus aureus or Streptococcus pyogenes which spreads by direct contact
Risk factors: Day care, crowding, poor nutrition, diabetes mellitus, contact sports, breaks in the skin
Prevention: Hand washing, avoiding infected people, cleaning injuries

Name: Impotence
Symptoms: Inability to gain or maintain an erection
Risk factors: cardiovascular disease, diabetes

Name: Infant reflux
Symptoms: Taste of acid, heartburn, bad breath, chest pain, breathing problems
Causes: Inadequate closure of the lower esophageal sphincter
Risk factors: Obesity, pregnancy, smoking, hiatal hernia, taking certain medicines
Diagnostic method: Gastroscopy, upper GI series, esophageal pH monitoring, esophageal manometry
Medication: Antacids, H2 receptor blockers, proton pump inhibitors, prokinetics

Name: Inguinal hernia
Symptoms: Pain, bulging in the groin
Risk factors: Family history, smoking, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, obesity, pregnancy, peritoneal dialysis, collagen vascular disease, connective tissue disease, previous open appendectomy

Name: Intestinal obstruction
Symptoms: Abdominal pain, vomiting, bloating, not passing gas
Causes: Adhesions, hernias, volvulus, endometriosis, inflammatory bowel disease, appendicitis, tumors, diverticulitis, ischemic bowel, tuberculosis, intussusception

Name: Iritis

Name: Iron deficiency anemia
Symptoms: Feeling tired, weakness, shortness of breath, confusion, pallor
Medication: Iron supplements, vitamin C, blood transfusions

Name: Irritable bowel syndrome
Symptoms: Diarrhea, constipation, abdominal pain
Diagnostic method: Based on symptoms, exclusion of other diseases

Name: Keratoconus
Symptoms: Blurry vision, nearsightedness, light sensitivity

Name: Klinefelter syndrome
Symptoms: Above average height, weaker muscles, poor coordination, less body hair, breast growth, less interest in sex, infertility.
Causes: Two or more X chromosomes in males
Risk factors: Older mother
Treatment: Physical therapy, speech and language therapy, counseling

Name: Krabbe disease
Symptoms: Infancy: Developmental delay, irritability, spasticity, hypotonia, microcephaly, optic atrophyJuvenile: Muscle weakness, vision loss, developmental regressionAdult: Burning paresthesias in extremities, loss of manual dexterity, muscle weakness, sensory neuropathy, muscle atrophy

Prognosis: One-, two-, and three-year survival rates of 60%, 26%, and 14%, respectively

Name: Laryngitis
Symptoms: Hoarse voice, fever, pain
Diagnostic method: Based on symptoms, examination via laryngoscopy if concerns

Name: Lead poisoning
Symptoms: Intellectual disability, abdominal pain, constipation, headaches, irritability, memory problems, inability to have children, tingling in the hands and feet
Causes: Exposure to lead via contaminated air, water, dust, food, consumer products
Risk factors: Being a child
Prevention: Removing lead from the home, improved monitoring and education in the workplace, laws that ban lead in products

Name: Legg-Calve-Perthes disease
Symptoms: Pain in the hip, knee, ankle (hip pathology can refer pain to a normal knee or ankle), or groin.
Causes: Artery of the ligmentum teres femoris being constricted or even blocked too early

Name: Leukoplakia
Symptoms: Firmly attached white patch on a mucous membrane, changes with time
Risk factors: Smoking, chewing tobacco, excessive alcohol, betel nuts
Diagnostic method: Made after other possible causes ruled out, tissue biopsy
Treatment: Close follow up, stop smoking, limit alcohol, surgical removal

Name: Lipoma
Symptoms: Soft, movable, usually painless lump
Risk factors: Family history, obesity, insufficient exercise

Name: Liposarcoma
Symptoms: Lump under skin, pain, swelling, organ dysfunction

Name: Listeriosis
Symptoms: Diarrhea, fever, headache
Risk factors: Immunocompromisation, pregnancy, diabetes mellitus
Diagnostic method: Culture of blood or spinal fluid
Prevention: Safe handling and preparation of food, avoidance of soft cheese by pregnant women

Name: Liver cancer
Symptoms: Lump or pain in the right side below the rib cage, swelling of the abdomen, yellowish skin, easy bruising, weight loss, weakness
Causes: hepatitis B, hepatitis C, alcohol, aflatoxin, non-alcoholic fatty liver disease, liver flukes
Diagnostic method: Blood tests, medical imaging, tissue biopsy
Prevention: Immunization against hepatitis B, treating those infected with hepatitis B or C, decreasing exposure to aflatoxin, decreasing high levels of alcohol consumption

Name: Long QT syndrome
Symptoms: Fainting, hearing loss, seizures
Causes: Genetic, certain medications, low blood potassium, low blood calcium, heart failure
Risk factors: Family history of sudden death
Treatment: Avoiding strenuous exercise, getting sufficient potassium, beta blockers, implantable cardiac defibrillator

Name: Low blood sugar
Symptoms: Clumsiness, shakiness, dizziness and giddiness, weakness, sweating, difficulty talking, confusion, loss of consciousness, seizures
Causes: Medications (insulin and sulfonylureas), sepsis, kidney failure, certain tumors, liver disease
Diagnostic method: Blood sugar level < 3.9Â mmol/L (70Â mg/dL) in a diabetic
Treatment: Eating foods high in simple sugars, dextrose, glucagon

Name: Lung cancer

Risk factors: Tobacco smokinggenetic factorsradon gasasbestosair pollution
Prevention: Not smoking, avoiding radon gas, asbestos, second-hand smoke, or other forms of air pollution exposure.

Name: Lung collapse
Symptoms: Chest pain, shortness of breath, tiredness
Risk factors: COPD, tuberculosis, smoking
Treatment: conservative, needle aspiration, chest tube, pleurodesis

Name: Lupus nephritis
Symptoms: Joint pain or swelling

Name: Lyme disease
Symptoms: Expanding area of redness at the site of a tick bite, fever, headache, tiredness
Diagnostic method: Based on symptoms, tick exposure, blood tests
Prevention: Prevention of tick bites (clothing the limbs, DEET), doxycycline

Name: Lymphedema
Specialty: Vascular medicine, Rheumatology, Physical medicine and rehabilitation General surgery, Plastic surgery

Name: Lymphoma
Symptoms: Enlarged lymph nodes, fever, sweats, unintended weight loss, itching, feeling tired
Risk factors: Epsteinâ€“Barr virus, autoimmune diseases, HIV/AIDS, tobacco smoking
Treatment: Chemotherapy, radiation therapy, proton therapy, targeted therapy, surgery

Name: Major depressive disorder
Symptoms: Low mood, low self-esteem, loss of interest in normally enjoyable activities, low energy, pain without a clear cause
Causes: environmental (adverse life experiences, stressful life events), Genetic and psychological factors
Risk factors: Family history, major life changes, certain medications, chronic health problems, substance use disorder
Treatment: Psychotherapy, antidepressant medication, electroconvulsive therapy, exercise

Name: Malaria
Symptoms: Fever, vomiting, headache, yellow skin
Diagnostic method: Examination of the blood, antigen detection tests
Prevention: Mosquito nets, insect repellent, mosquito control, medications

Name: Malignant hyperthermia
Symptoms: Muscle rigidity, high body temperature, fast heart rate
Causes: Volatile anesthetic agents or succinylcholine in those who are susceptible
Prevention: Avoiding potential triggers in those susceptible
Frequency: ~1 in 25,000 cases where anesthetic gases are used

Name: Mammary duct ectasia
Symptoms: nipple retraction, inversion, pain, green-brown discharge

Name: Manic-depressive illness
Symptoms: Periods of depression and elevated mood
Risk factors: Family history, childhood abuse, long-term stress

Name: Marfan syndrome
Symptoms: Tall, thin build; long arms, legs and fingers; flexible fingers and toes
Medication: Beta blockers, calcium channel blockers, ACE inhibitors

Name: Mastalgia
Causes: Menstrual cycle related, birth control pills, hormone therapy, psychiatric medication, breast cancer
Treatment: Reassurance after ruling out cancer, medications

Name: Mastitis
Symptoms: Localized breast pain and redness, fever

Name: Meningioma
Symptoms: None, seizures, dementia, trouble talking, vision problems, one sided weakness
Risk factors: Ionizing radiation, family history
Prognosis: 95% ten year survival with complete removal

Name: Meningitis
Symptoms: Fever, headache, neck stiffness

Name: Menopause

Causes: Usually a natural change. Can also be caused by surgery that removes both ovaries and some types of chemotherapy.
Medication: Menopausal hormone therapy, clonidine, gabapentin, selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors

Name: Mental illness
Symptoms: Agitation, anxiety, depression, mania, paranoia, psychosis
Medication: Antidepressants, antipsychotics, anxiolytics, mood stabilizers, stimulants

Name: Mesenteric ischemia
Symptoms: Acute: sudden severe painChronic: abdominal pain after eating, unintentional weight loss, vomiting

Frequency: Acute: 5 per 100,000 per year (developed world)Chronic: 1 per 100,000

Name: Mesothelioma
Symptoms: Shortness of breath, swollen abdomen, chest wall pain, cough, feeling tired, weight loss
Risk factors: Genetics, infection with simian virus 40
Diagnostic method: Medical imaging, examining fluid produced by the cancer, tissue biopsy

Name: Metachromatic leukodystrophy
Symptoms: Progressive neurologic decline
Usual onset: Late infantile (1-2 years), juvenile (3-20 years) or adulthood (around 40s)
Duration: Late infantile (3-10 years), juvenile and adult (varies)

Name: Microcephaly
Symptoms: Abnormally small head and brain, neurological impairments
Causes: Usually genetic or toxin exposure during pregnancy

Name: Microscopic colitis
Symptoms: Persistent diarrhea

Name: Migraine
Symptoms: Headaches, nausea, sensitivity to light, sensitivity to sound, sensitivity to smell
Risk factors: Family history, female

Name: Milk intolerance
Symptoms: Abdominal pain, bloating, diarrhea, flatulence, nausea
Causes: Decreased ability to digest lactose (genetic, small intestine injury)
Treatment: Decreasing lactose in the diet, lactase supplements, treat the underlying cause
Frequency: ~65% of people (less common in Northern Europeans)

Name: Miscarriage
Symptoms: Vaginal bleeding with or without pain

Diagnostic method: Physical examination, human chorionic gonadotropin, ultrasound

Name: Mitral valve disease

Name: Molluscum contagiosum

Risk factors: Weak immune system, atopic dermatitis, crowded living conditions

Treatment: None, freezing, opening up the lesion and scraping the inside, laser therapy

Name: Mucocutaneous lymph node syndrome

Name: Muscle strains
Symptoms: Bruise, swelling, redness and soreness
Causes: Excessive stress and/or repeated injury on a muscle

Name: Muscular dystrophy
Symptoms: Increasing weakening, breakdown of skeletal muscles, trouble walking
Causes: Genetic (X-linked recessive, autosomal recessive, or autosomal dominant)
Treatment: Pharmacotherapy, physical therapy, braces, corrective surgery, assisted ventilation

Name: Myasthenia gravis
Symptoms: Varying degrees muscle weakness, double vision, drooping eyelids, trouble talking, trouble walking
Diagnostic method: Blood tests for specific antibodies, edrophonium test, nerve conduction studies
Treatment: Medications, surgical removal of the thymus, plasmapheresis

Name: Myelodysplastic syndromes
Symptoms: None, feeling tired, shortness of breath, easy bleeding, frequent infections
Risk factors: Previous chemotherapy, radiation therapy, certain chemicals such as tobacco smoke, pesticides, and benzene, exposure to mercury or lead
Treatment: Supportive care, medications, stem cell transplantation

Name: Myocardial infarction
Symptoms: Chest pain, shortness of breath, nausea, feeling faint, cold sweat, feeling tired; arm, neck, back, jaw, or stomach pain
Risk factors: High blood pressure, smoking, diabetes, lack of exercise, obesity, high blood cholesterol

Name: Myocardial ischemia
Symptoms: Chest pain, shortness of breath
Causes: Atherosclerosis of the arteries of the heart
Risk factors: High blood pressure, smoking, diabetes, lack of exercise, obesity, high blood cholesterol
Diagnostic method: Electrocardiogram, cardiac stress test, coronary computed tomographic angiography, coronary angiogram

Treatment: Percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI), coronary artery bypass surgery (CABG)

Name: Myocarditis
Symptoms: Shortness of breath, chest pain, decreased ability to exercise, irregular heartbeat
Causes: Usually viral infection, also bacterial infections, certain medications, autoimmune disorders
Diagnostic method: Electrocardiogram, blood troponin, heart MRI, heart biopsy
Treatment: Medications, implantable cardiac defibrillator, heart transplant
Medication: ACE inhibitors, beta blockers, diuretics, corticosteroids, intravenous immunoglobulin

Name: Myxofibrosarcoma
Specialty: Dermatology, Dermatopathology, Pathology, Surgical oncology, Oncology

Name: Nearsightedness
Symptoms: Distant objects appear blurry, close objects appear normal, headaches, eye strain

Risk factors: Near work, greater time spent indoors, family history

Name: Nephrogenic systemic fibrosis
Causes: iatrogenic disease caused by exposure to gadolinium-based contrast agents
Risk factors: impaired kidney function is the major risk factor

Name: Nephrotic syndrome
Symptoms: Swelling, weight gain, feeling tired, foamy urine
Causes: Focal segmental glomerulosclerosis, membranous nephropathy, minimal change disease, diabetes, lupus

Name: Neuroblastoma
Symptoms: Bone pain, lumps

Name: Nonalcoholic fatty liver disease
Symptoms: Asymptomatic, liver dysfunction
Risk factors: Obesity, metabolic syndrome, type 2 diabetes mellitus, liver disease
Frequency: 24% in worldwide population, 80% in obese, 20% in normal-weight

Name: Nontropical sprue
Symptoms: None or non-specific, abdominal distention, diarrhoea, constipation, malabsorption, weight loss, dermatitis herpetiformis
Risk factors: Genetic predisposition, type 1 diabetes, autoimmune thyroid disease, Down and Turner syndrome
Diagnostic method: Family history, blood antibody tests, intestinal biopsies, genetic testing, response to gluten withdrawal

Name: Noonan syndrome
Symptoms: Mildly unusual facial features, short height, congenital heart disease, bleeding problems, skeletal malformations
Diagnostic method: Suspected based on symptoms, confirmed with genetic testing
Prognosis: Depends on the severity of heart problems

Name: Norovirus infection
Symptoms: Diarrhea, vomiting, stomach pain, headache
Prevention: Hand washing, disinfection of contaminated surfaces
Treatment: Supportive care (drinking sufficient fluids or intravenous fluids)

Name: Nose fracture
Symptoms: Nose bleed, swelling, bruising
Causes: Assault, trauma during sports, falls, motor vehicle collisions
Diagnostic method: Typically based on symptoms, occasionally plain X rays
Treatment: Pain medication, cold compresses, possible reduction post resolution of swelling

Name: OCD
Symptoms: Feel the need to check things repeatedly, perform certain routines repeatedly, have certain thoughts repeatedly
Risk factors: Child abuse, stress
Treatment: Counseling, selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors, clomipramine

Name: Oral cancer
Specialty: Oncology, oral and maxillofacial surgery, ENT surgery
Symptoms: Persistent rough white or red patch in the mouth lasting longer than 2 weeks, ulceration, lumps/bumps in the neck, pain, loose teeth, difficulty swallowing
Risk factors: Smoking, alcohol, HPV infection, sun exposure, chewing tobacco

Name: Osgood-Schlatter disease
Symptoms: Painful bump just below the knee, worse with activity and better with rest
Usual onset: Males between the ages of 10 and 15
Risk factors: Sports that involve running or jumping

Name: Osteoarthritis
Symptoms: Joint pain, stiffness, joint swelling, decreased range of motion
Causes: Connective tissue disease, previous joint injury, abnormal joint or limb development, inherited factors
Risk factors: Overweight, legs of different lengths, job with high levels of joint stress
Diagnostic method: Based on symptoms, supported by other testing
Treatment: Exercise, efforts to decrease joint stress, support groups, pain medications, joint replacement

Name: Osteomyelitis
Symptoms: Pain in a specific bone, overlying redness, fever, weakness
Risk factors: Diabetes, intravenous drug use, prior removal of the spleen, trauma to the area
Diagnostic method: Blood tests, medical imaging, bone biopsy
Prognosis: Low risk of death with treatment

Name: Osteonecrosis
Symptoms: Joint pain, decreased ability to move
Risk factors: Bone fractures, joint dislocations, alcoholism, high dose steroids
Treatment: Medication, not walking on the affected leg, stretching, surgery
